alert.note: Alert for Broome; Tioga (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 22 at 4:51AM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Broome, southeastern Tioga, northwestern Susquehanna and northeastern Bradford Counties through 530 AM EDT... At 450 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Rome, or 7 miles southeast of Athens, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Binghamton, Vestal, Johnson City, Endicott, Kirkwood, Sayre, Conklin, Owego, Athens and Towanda. This includes the following highway exits... New York Interstate 81 between 1 and 7. Interstate 86/Route 17 between 62 and 78. Interstate 88 between 1 and 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
